p: The tocopherol profile of hemp by-products is dominated by γ-tocopherol ( Table 4), which is the tocopherol with the strongest antioxidant activity, but α-tocopherol is regarded as the most vital form ( 42, 60, 61). The α-tocopherol content of hemp by-products exceed dietary requirements for physiological function of growing small ruminants (10–20 mg/kg DM) and cattle (15–60 mg/kg) ( 33, 62), but below values (270–287 mg/kg) required to extend meat shelf life ( 63, 64).
